verses.text: Yo, these are Solomon’s proverbs — straight facts from Israel’s king, son of David.
They drop wisdom and understanding, so you can know life and make smart moves.
They teach right living, fairness, and keeping it real in the world.
They give sense to beginners and knowledge to young peeps.
Even the wise can hear more and level up.
They help understand puzzles, clever sayings, and hidden truths.
Respecting God is the start of real wisdom. Ignore Him? You’re just foolish.
Listen up, my kid — don’t ghost your father’s advice or skip your mother’s teaching.
Their words are like chains of honor — they protect and bless you.
If the wrong crowd tries to pull you into shady moves, don’t roll with them.
They might say, “Come, let’s lie in wait for someone to steal from them.” Don’t go there.
They lie in wait for evil, planning harm.
They think, “We’ll get rich by doing wrong.” Don’t follow that path.
Stay away — their way ends in disaster.
My child, keep your feet clean; don’t step into their mess.
Their path is risky, their ways collapse on themselves.
Stolen gain is useless — the trap is set in vain.
The violent/wicked lie in wait for their own lives — self-destruction comes for them.
Greed never wins; it always backfires.
Wisdom shouts in the streets, calling out in public squares.
She speaks at city gates, calling out to those who lack sense.
But fools ignore her, scrolling past, thinking she’s irrelevant.
“Turn to me and live,” she says. “Pay attention — blessings follow.”
But they refuse and reject her advice.
When trouble comes, they’re shocked: “Where was the warning?”
I called, but they ignored me; their choices trap them.
Trouble comes like a storm, and fear won’t save them.
They cry for help, but it’s too late — trapped by their own decisions.
They hated knowledge and rejected wisdom.
So they pay for ignoring her words.
Foolishness traps them; consequences are real.
Their choices roast them; consequences hit hard.
But anyone who listens to Wisdom will live safe, chill, and blessed — no stress, no fear.
Yo, my kid, if you vibe with my words and keep my commands close,
Tune in, pay attention to wisdom, and chase understanding.
Call for it like it’s the hottest drop — search for it like you’re hunting treasure.
Seek it like rare loot, grinding hard like it’s your main quest.
If you do, you’ll finally get the fear of the Lord and find knowledge of God.
‘Cause God’s the plug — He drops wisdom, understanding, and insight straight.
He keeps the righteous safe, guarding those who walk in integrity.
He shields the true-hearted, protecting them from wrong moves.
Then you’ll understand righteousness, justice, and fairness — all the real moves.
Wisdom slides in, and knowledge vibes with your soul.
Discretion guards you, and understanding watches your back.
They’ll save you from shady paths, from people walking twisted ways.
From those who leave the straight track and wander into darkness.
From people acting shady, scheming evil, and rolling in sin.
Their path is crooked; their steps collapse on themselves.
Wisdom saves you from the smooth talkers who seduce with lies.
From those who abandon loyalty and leave their true paths.
Their house leads to death; their paths are fatal.
Anyone stuck in that chaos won’t return — destruction is waiting.
Walk in the way of good people, stick to the path of the righteous.
Then you’ll inhabit the land securely; the upright remain planted there.
But the wicked? They’re removed from life — their fate ends in ruin.
My kid, don’t forget my words; keep my commands close to your heart.
They’ll add length to your life and bring peace every day.
Don’t lose loyalty and love — keep them tight around your neck; they’ll flex honor and respect.
Then you’ll gain favor and a solid reputation with God and people.
Trust the Lord fully; don’t lean only on your own brain.
In everything you do, acknowledge Him, and He’ll make your path straight.
Don’t act all wise in your own eyes — fear God, and steer clear of evil.
That’ll bring health to your body and strength to your bones.
Honor God with your wealth; give your firstfruits of all your crops.
Then your barns will overflow, and your vats will run over with juice.
My kid, don’t ghost the Lord’s discipline; don’t get mad when He corrects you.
God trains the ones He loves, like a coach pushing their star player.
Blessed is the one who grabs wisdom — they’re living the dream.
She’s more valuable than silver; her reward beats gold.
She’s worth more than jewels; nothing you want compares.
Long life is in her right hand; wealth and honor in her left.
Her ways are pleasant, and all her paths are chill.
She’s a tree of life for those who hold her tight; whoever grabs her is blessed.
By wisdom, the Lord laid the earth’s foundations and set the skies in place.
By His knowledge, the depths split, and clouds drip dew.
My kid, keep wisdom and discretion tight; don’t lose them.
They’ll be life for your soul and flex for your neck.
Then you’ll walk without stress and sleep safe, no nightmares.
When you lie down, you won’t fear; you’ll snooze, peaceful.
Don’t stress over sudden drama or the chaos of the wicked.
God will keep you safe; He’ll guard your life.
Don’t hold back good from people who deserve it when you can act.
Don’t say, “Go come back tomorrow,” when you can help today.
Don’t plot harm against your neighbor — they’re counting on you.
Don’t fight over nothing; stay chill with people.
Don’t envy violent people; don’t copy their ways.
The Lord hates wickedness but loves those who walk right.
The Lord blesses the home of the righteous, but the house of the wicked is doomed.
He mocks the mockers but gives grace to the humble.
The wise inherit glory, but fools get nothing but shame.
My kids, listen up — tune in to your parents’ teaching; pay attention to get wisdom.
These words are life; don’t ghost them.
I was a kid too; my father taught me, my mom showed me the ropes.
They said, “Hold onto this knowledge — it’s your shield.”
Grab wisdom, level up, don’t let go; get insight and keep it close.
Flex it like a chain around your neck; it’ll keep you safe.
Wisdom is top-tier — get it, and life is unlocked. Understanding comes with the grind.
Keep it high, and it’ll lift you; embrace it, and it’ll protect you.
Its glow is like a crown; its shine is like a chain of honor.
Listen, my kid, and your life will be lit; years will be added to your grind.
I’ll teach you the right path; I’ll guide you on the straight track.
Walk it and you won’t trip; step by step, you’ll be safe.
Grab wisdom tight; don’t let it go — it’s your life’s main flex.
Don’t roll with the wicked; don’t vibe with the shady crowd.
Avoid their path; don’t walk where they wander.
The wicked can’t chill — they stay up scheming evil, robbed of sleep until someone falls.
They live off wickedness and violence; that’s their daily bread and wine.
The path of the righteous? Shines brighter and brighter; their grind gets clearer every day.
But the wicked? They live in darkness; their path is sketchy and doomed.
My kid, pay attention to my words; listen closely to what I say.
Don’t let them drift off; keep them in your heart, guard them tight.
They’re life for your soul; health for your whole vibe.
Above all, guard your heart — it’s the main source of life.
Don’t let your mouth slip evil; keep your lips from lying.
Eyes forward, straight ahead; watch your path, no side glances.
Make level paths for your feet; don’t wobble.
Don’t veer left or right; keep moving on the straight track.
My kid, pay attention to my wisdom; lean in to get insight.
Guard discretion; keep your lips from shady moves.
The lips of the adulterous are honey-sweet, smooth talk.
But in the end, they’re bitter as wormwood, sharp like a double-edged sword.
Their feet go down to death; their steps run straight to the shades.
They don’t even pause to look at the path of life.
My kid, listen to me; don’t stray from my words of guidance.
Stay clear, don’t wander toward their house.
Don’t give your honor to strangers; don’t let your years go to cruel people.
Don’t let your cash and grind go to strangers; don’t let your hard work end up in outsiders’ hands.
Then you’ll groan when your body and life are wasted,
And you say, “How did I hate instruction? How did I despise correction?”
I didn’t listen to advice; I ignored all warnings.
I ended up in the crowd of the foolish, lost in the gang of the wicked.
Drink water from your own cistern, fresh water from your own well.
Should your fountains be scattered in the streets, streams of your blessing out where they don’t belong?
Let it be only for you; don’t share it with outsiders.
Be blessed with the wife of your youth; enjoy her love every day.
She’s your charm, your love — never lose sight of her grace.
Why be consumed with strangers, the smooth talk of others?
The Lord sees all your ways; He watches every step you take.
The wicked are caught by their own sin; they are trapped by the ways of their actions.
The consequences of sin? Death, no excuses — the righteous live safe through the fear of God.
My kid, if you co-sign for a friend, you’re basically risking your bag.
You’ve trapped yourself; now you’re on the hook.
Break free fast — tell them, “Yo, I’m out,” before your wallet gets wrecked.
Don’t let them drag you down; save yourself before you fall.
Don’t slack, free yourself like a gazelle escaping a trap.
Check out the ant, lazybones — no boss, no schedule, still stacking food all summer.
They grind hard, no excuses; they prep for tomorrow while you sleep.
You should be wise too; stash your moves and prep like the ant.
How long will you crash in bed, lazy? When will you actually rise and grind?
A little nap, a little sleep, a little folding of hands to chill —
And boom! Poverty hits you like a hitmarker; want bites, end up broke.
A wicked dude? Smooth talker, plotting evil — his words slice deep.
He winks, nods, shakes hands, all fake — scheming in silence.
He plants trouble everywhere, ready to spark chaos at every turn.
Disaster’s coming for him; sudden ruin, no saving.
There are six things the Lord hates, seven that He can’t vibe with:
Proud eyes, lying tongue, hands that spill innocent blood,
Heart that plots evil, feet that rush to do wrong,
False witness dropping lies, one who sparks drama between siblings.
My kid, keep your father’s command; don’t ghost your mother’s rules.
Bind them tight around your neck; carry them wherever you roll.
They’ll guide you — wisdom, insight — when the grind gets rough.
The command is a lamp; instruction is light; correction is the path to life.
They’ll keep you safe from evil moves, protecting your vibe.
Don’t cheat on your love, don’t lust after a stranger.
For the adultery-seeker? Even the hardest man gets played; they get trapped.
Can a fire burn in your lap without roasting your thighs?
Can a wanderer walk on coals and not scorch their feet?
So whoever messes around with another’s spouse ends up burned by their own sin.
Thieves? They hate being caught.
But if caught, they pay back sevenfold, double the damage.
Sleeping with someone else’s spouse? No chill — destroys life, nothing but regret.
Wounds and shame hit hard; your reputation gone.
Fumes of rage from the betrayed partner, no mercy, no compromise.
The one who cheats? They’ll never escape; they’re trapped in their own foolishness.
Yo, guard my words like your ultimate flex; keep my commands locked in your chest.
Wear them like a chain around your neck, let them guide every step.
They’ll save you from the traps fools lay out for themselves.
Tell Wisdom, “You’re my real one; Insight, you’re my squad” — keep her close.
They’ll watch over your path, keep you from the schemes of evil.
I peeped out my window, late night — streets quiet, but alert.
A young man, clueless, heading the wrong way, naive in the game.
At the corner, there she was — the woman who’s trouble.
He didn’t know; desire blinded him fully.
She’s bold, reckless, fully plotting.
Up late, looking for someone to snare.
Bed ready, fine linens, perfume set — everything prepared.
She meets him, moves smooth, eyes on the prize.
Words slick, pulling him closer, no hesitation.
“I came out to meet you, been seeking your face, and here you are.”
“My bed is ready, linens fresh, perfume on point.”
“Come, let’s enjoy ourselves till morning, let’s go all in.”
“Hubby’s away, long trip, won’t be back soon.”
“No one’s watching; no one will catch us.”
He follows blindly, desire taking the wheel, ignoring danger.
Kid, keep your eyes sharp; don’t walk her path.
Her house leads down to Sheol, straight to the chambers of death.
None who enter her return; her paths destroy.
Don’t chase fleeting thrills; avoid her trap.
Guard your heart; keep your focus.
Don’t get snared by her looks; don’t follow her steps.
Her house? The way to Sheol, down to the chambers of death — all who enter it are caught.
Doesn’t wisdom literally call out? And understanding be out here projecting her voice?
She sets up on the highest spots, where everybody passes and nobody can pretend they didn’t hear her.
She posts up at city gates and main entrances, calling people out as they walk in.
“Yo humanity, I’m talking to all of you — nobody is exempt.”
“If you’re naive, level up. If you lack sense, upgrade your brain.”
“Listen up — I’m dropping straight facts, no confusion.”
“My mouth only speaks truth; no fake, twisted energy allowed.”
“Everything I say is legit and right; nothing is crooked or sketchy.”
“If you’ve got sense, you’ll get it. If your mind is on, it’ll click.”
“Choose my instruction instead of cash, and knowledge over gold — yeah, I said it.”
“Wisdom beats jewels. Anything you hype doesn’t top me.”
“I, wisdom, roll with good judgment. I carry knowledge and strategic thinking.”
“Respect for the LORD means hating evil. I can’t stand pride, arrogance, or shady behavior.”
“I’ve got advice, stability, intelligence, and power — full package.”
“Through me, kings run their kingdoms right.”
“Through me, leaders and rulers make solid laws.”
“I vibe with those who seek me, and those who chase me will definitely find me.”
“Riches and honor hang around me — long-term wealth and the type of success that actually lasts.”
“My rewards beat gold and pure gold; what I bring outshines the best silver.”
“I move on righteous paths and walk in justice that’s actually fair.”
“I bless the ones who stick with me, filling them with real wealth.”
“The LORD made me part of His setup from the very beginning — before everything else existed.”
“I was established before time kicked off, before the world even loaded.”
“Before oceans existed, before springs burst out, I was already here.”
“Before mountains and hills were built up, I was present.”
“Before land, fields, and even the first dust of the earth — I was in the mix.”
“When He set up the sky, I was there. When He drew the horizon over the waters, I was there too.”
“When He established the clouds above and locked the springs deep below…”
“When He gave the sea its boundary so it wouldn’t cross the line, and when He shaped the foundations of the earth…”
“I was right beside Him, like a constant worker, rejoicing with Him every day.”
“I celebrated His whole creation and found joy with the human race.”
“So listen up, children: stay locked in with me and you’ll be blessed.”
“Grab instruction and don’t ignore it — be wise.”
“Blessed is the one who listens to me daily, watching for me like it’s a routine.”
“Whoever finds me finds life and gains favor from the LORD.”
“But whoever ignores me harms themselves — choosing me or rejecting me is literally choosing life or losing it.”
Wisdom built her house and set up her seven solid pillars.
She prepped her food, mixed her drink, and laid out the table like she’s hosting a whole event.
She sent out her servants and shouted from the highest spots in the city.
“If you’re naive, pull up here.” To the one lacking sense she says,
“Come eat what I’ve prepared and drink what I’ve mixed.”
“Drop the foolish lifestyle and live. Walk in the path that actually makes sense.”
Whoever tries to correct a mocker just ends up catching trouble; calling out a wicked person gets you dragged.
Don’t waste correction on a mocker — they’ll just hate you for it. But correct a wise person, and they’ll appreciate it.
Teach a wise person and they level up even more. Teach a righteous person and they get even sharper.
Respect for the LORD is where wisdom starts, and knowing Him is where real understanding begins.
Through wisdom, your days increase and your life gains more weight.
If you’re wise, it benefits you. If you’re foolish, you hurt yourself — nobody else takes the fall for your choices.
Folly is loud, chaotic, and clueless.
She sits at her doorway, chilling on the high places where people walk by.
She calls out to the ones passing by minding their business.
“If you’re naive, pull up here.” And to the one lacking sense she says,
“Stolen stuff tastes sweet, and secret bread hits different.”
But the person who listens to her doesn’t realize the place she leads to is full of the dead — her guests are in the depths.
A wise child makes their parent proud; a foolish one brings heaviness.
Shady money doesn’t help, but doing what’s right saves your life.
The LORD won’t let the righteous starve, but He shuts down the cravings of the wicked.
Lazy hands make you broke; hardworking hands secure the bag.
A wise person works while it’s time; a foolish one wastes the season and brings shame.
Blessings land on the righteous, but the wicked’s words hide trouble.
The memory of the righteous hits different, but the wicked’s name fades.
The wise accept instruction; the foolish talk and trip over their own words.
Whoever walks straight is safe; whoever moves shady gets exposed.
Winking to deceive causes trouble; foolish talk destroys.
The righteous speak life like a fountain; the wicked hide harmful intentions.
Hate stirs drama; love shuts drama down.
Wisdom sits naturally on the wise, but foolish people get corrected the hard way.
The wise store knowledge; the foolish talk too much and get ruined.
The wealthy’s resources are their stronghold; poverty crushes the poor.
The righteous earn outcomes that lead to life; the wicked chase things that lead to sin.
Whoever takes correction stays on the right track; whoever ignores it leads others off it.
Hiding hatred and spreading lies both bring trouble; slander is foolish.
Too much talking always leads to mistakes; the wise keep their words tight.
The words of the righteous are like premium silver; the wicked’s words barely count.
The righteous feed many with wisdom; foolish people destroy themselves because they won’t learn.
The LORD’s blessing makes you rich, and He doesn’t attach sorrow to it.
Foolish people treat evil like entertainment; wise people enjoy doing what’s right.
The wicked get the very thing they fear; the righteous receive what they desire.
When storms hit, the wicked get swept away; the righteous stay standing.
A lazy person is like smoke to the eyes or vinegar to the teeth — just irritating.
Respect for the LORD extends your life; wicked living cuts it short.
The righteous expect good outcomes; the wicked have hopes that collapse.
The LORD’s way is strength for the upright, but ruins those who do evil.
The righteous will not be removed; the wicked won’t stay in the land.
The mouth of the righteous speaks wisdom; the twisted tongue gets cut off.
The righteous know what fits and is good to say; the wicked only speak what’s off.
Fake scales disgust the LORD, but accurate weights make Him pleased.
When pride shows up, disgrace follows; humility brings wisdom.
The integrity of the upright guides them; the unfaithful get ruined by their own crookedness.
Riches can’t save you on the day of judgment, but doing what’s right delivers you.
The righteousness of the upright clears their path; the wicked fall because of their own wickedness.
Doing right saves the honest; the unfaithful get trapped by their own desires.
When the wicked die, their expectations collapse; their hopes vanish instantly.
The righteous get rescued from trouble, and the wicked take the hit instead.
A hypocrite destroys others with their words, but the righteous escape through knowledge.
When the righteous thrive, a city celebrates; when the wicked fall, there’s relief.
Upright people lift a city up; wicked mouths tear it down.
Anyone who lacks sense insults their neighbor; the wise stay quiet.
A gossip leaks secrets; a trustworthy person keeps things covered.
Without guidance, a community collapses; with many wise voices, there’s safety.
Putting yourself on the line for someone recklessly leads to trouble; refusing that stays safe.
A gracious person gains honor; violent people gain only empty wins.
A kind person benefits themselves; a cruel person harms their own life.
The wicked earn deceptive results; the one who does right gets a real reward.
Living rightly leads to life; chasing evil leads to death.
Those with twisted hearts disgust the LORD; those who walk straight bring Him delight.
Count on this: evil will not go unpunished, but the children of the righteous will be delivered.
Beauty without discretion is like a gold ring in a pig’s snout.
The desires of the righteous aim toward good; the expectations of the wicked end in anger.
One person gives freely and ends up with more; another hoards and becomes poorer.
The generous become refreshed; those who refresh others get refreshed themselves.
People curse those who hoard grain, but bless the one who sells it openly.
Whoever seeks good finds favor; whoever looks for trouble gets it.
Those who trust in wealth fall; the righteous flourish like healthy leaves.
Whoever brings disturbance on their household inherits nothing; the foolish end up serving the wise.
The fruit of the righteous is life-giving, and the one who wins souls is wise.
If the righteous receive consequences on earth, the wicked and the sinner will definitely face theirs.
Loving correction makes you wise; ignoring it is straight-up foolish.
The LORD blesses people who do right, but He smashes the plans of the schemers.
No one standing crooked will last; the upright stay solid.
A good wife? She’s a crown on her husband. A worthless one? Straight chaos.
The plans of the righteous are solid; the advice of the wicked? Pure nonsense.
The words of the wicked are traps; the speech of the upright saves.
The wicked get cut off and gone; the righteous stick around like solid roots.
A wise person’s heart keeps them alive; a fool gets destroyed by their own vibes.
Laziness makes you wish you had clothes; hard work makes you rich.
The righteous care for animals; the wicked are straight-up cruel.
Working the land pays off; just sitting around dreaming gets you nothing.
The wicked chase the sinful crowd; the upright chase truth.
Bad talk leads to trouble; righteous speech saves.
Words can feed you good things; life is in the words of the wise.
Fools think they’re always right; the wise listen before moving.
Fools get hot-headed; the prudent stay calm.
Honest people speak the truth; liars spread chaos.
Reckless words can slice like swords; the wise speak carefully.
Truthful lips last forever; lying lips are just temporary.
The wicked are trapped by their own evil; the upright enjoy security.
Trouble sticks to the wicked; blessings hug the righteous.
Lying lips? Total disgust to the LORD; honest talk? Full delight.
Clever people hide what they know; fools shout out what they shouldn’t.
Hardworking hands rule; lazy ones get dragged.
Worries weigh people down; kind words lift them up.
True friends guide the righteous; the wicked get dragged by false friends.
Laziness rots your plans; energy brings profit.
Righteousness leads straight to life; wickedness is a dead-end street.
A wise kid listens to correction; a fool ignores it and keeps messing up.
Good words bring life; bad talk pulls people down.
Guard your mouth and stay safe; careless words get you in trouble.
Lazy people want big things but get nothing; the hardworking always get results.
The righteous avoid drama; the wicked are full of shady vibes.
Righteousness protects; wickedness sets traps.
Some pretend to be rich but got nothing; the wise know their real value.
Wealth can save lives, but the poor’s hope dies fast.
Honest light shines bright; the wicked’s lamp goes out.
Pride sparks fights; wisdom comes with humility.
Quick riches vanish; hard-earned wealth grows.
Hope delayed hurts, but fulfilled desires are sweet.
Ignoring correction brings destruction; accepting advice is life.
Wise people live on knowledge; fools get snared by stupidity.
Good sense leads to life; fools go the wrong way.
Every move has consequences; fools act without thinking.
Bad messengers get caught in trouble; trustworthy ones deliver safely.
Poverty hits those who ignore correction; listening to instruction brings honor.
Longing fulfilled is sweet to the soul; fools chase temporary thrills.
Walk with wise people and level up; hang with fools and fall.
Trouble chases the wicked; blessings hug the righteous.
Good people leave inheritances for their fam; the sinner’s wealth disappears.
Fodder feeds the poor; foolish talk can ruin your plans.
Discipline is love for your kids; ignoring them is hate.
The righteous are satisfied with good; the wicked crave trouble.
A wise woman builds her house; a foolish one tears it down herself.
Walking right pleases the LORD; following shady paths makes Him annoyed.
Fools talk too much and annoy everyone; the wise hold back words.
Lazy hands make chaos; hard work keeps things in order.
Honest witnesses speak truth; liars deceive.
Fools think they know everything; the wise ask and learn.
Step back from drama; fools get caught in it.
The wise value knowledge; fools get destroyed by stupidity.
Fools laugh at sin; wise people take it seriously.
The heart carries its own pain; words can’t always fix it.
The LORD destroys the wicked’s home; He supports the righteous.
Some roads seem right but lead to death; check your steps.
Laugh now, cry later; joy ignored can turn to pain.
Living right satisfies the soul; chasing evil destroys it.
Simple people believe everything; the prudent test everything.
Wise people fear and plan; fools are reckless.
Quick anger leads to trouble; patience saves.
Fools get caught by their own mistakes; knowledge protects.
Evil people bow to good; the upright stand strong.
Poor people struggle with friends; rich have lots, but God remains the ultimate helper.
Treating others badly hurts you; showing kindness pays back.
People plan evil but fail; wise plans succeed.
Hard work brings profit; idle talk brings poverty.
The wise build their houses with knowledge; fools destroy theirs with folly.
Truth rescues; lying words trap.
Fear of the LORD keeps you safe; trusting yourself blindly is risky.
Fear of the LORD gives life; lazy people face hunger.
The righteous have lasting hope; the wicked fade.
Patient people calm fights; hotheads stir them up.
Health and peace keep life strong; fools ruin theirs.
Oppressing the poor is disrespecting God; helping them honors Him.
The wicked fall into traps; the righteous rise above.
Wisdom is deep in hearts; fools can’t reach it.
Righteousness brings glory; sin shames.
Honest rulers bless their people; wicked rulers curse.
Chill words calm fights; harsh words just stir drama.
Honest talk feeds the soul; lying lips destroy it.
The LORD sees everything, everywhere—nothing hides from Him.
Gentle words bring life; foolish words crush spirits.
Rejecting correction makes fools; taking advice makes you wise.
Wealth can fill a house, but the LORD’s favor fills it better.
The wise speak knowledge; fools spout nonsense.
The LORD hates fake offerings; He loves what’s right.
The wicked hate Him; those who follow Him love Him.
Harsh discipline comes to those who ignore correction; avoiding it hurts you.
Sheol and Abaddon are exposed before the LORD; He knows everything, even the hidden realms.
Fools hate advice; the wise accept correction.
Joy lights up the face; sadness crushes the spirit.
Fools think understanding is impossible; the wise value knowledge.
A simple life looks good to the upright; fools complain constantly.
Better little with the LORD than lots without Him.
It’s better to eat veggies in peace than feast with drama.
Quick tempers start fights; patience stops them.
Lazy people struggle; hard workers get results.
Wise friends lift you up; fools drag you down.
Acting dumb keeps people in trouble; planning wisely saves you.
Plans succeed with advice; going solo often fails.
Right words at the right time are pure gold; fools talk and trip.
The path of life goes up; it leads away from death.
The LORD lifts the humble; He brings down the proud.
Wicked people hate good; honest people love truth.
Greedy people hate the poor; generous hearts get blessings.
Patient people think first; fools explode.
The LORD listens to those who care; stubborn people get ignored.
A happy heart gives health to the body; a sad heart drains it.
The LORD listens to the faithful and punishes the proud.
Accepting correction grows life; ignoring it brings harm.
Respecting the LORD teaches wisdom; pride leads to shame.
People plan their moves, but the LORD decides how it all goes down.
We can think we’re pure, but the LORD checks our motives.
Commit your plans to the LORD, and He makes them succeed.
The LORD has set everything up, even the wicked, for His purposes.
Pride turns into trouble; the LORD despises arrogant vibes.
Love and loyalty cancel out sins; respecting the LORD is key.
When people follow God, He sets their steps straight—even enemies chill.
A little done right is better than huge gains through cheating.
People can make plans in their hearts, but the LORD guides the steps.
Kings speak judgment; wise rulers weigh every word.
Honest scales and balances are God’s standard; He sees every transaction.
It’s wrong to love evil; God loves justice and honesty.
The right words from a ruler bring joy; dishonest talk brings anger.
Anger of the king is scary; wise people know how to cool it.
A king’s favor is like sunshine—brightens your path; his wrath is stormy.
Wisdom is more valuable than gold; understanding is better than silver.
The path of the upright keeps you safe; the one who strays gets caught.
Pride leads to a fall; humility leads to honor.
It’s better to live humble with others than fight for power with fools.
Paying attention to words brings success; trusting the wrong lips can fail you.
Wise hearts bring understanding; clever mouths multiply learning.
Knowledge brings life to those who have it; foolishness destroys fools.
Wise people speak right; fools’ mouths bring trouble.
Kind words are like honey—sweet, healing, and good for the soul.
Some paths look easy but lead to death; check the way you choose.
Work tires the body, but the soul gains from effort.
Evil people plot trouble; violent ones spread chaos.
Gossip and lies stir fights; truth brings peace.
A violent person gets trapped; a wise peacemaker avoids it.
Even blind people avoid disaster if they have sense; fools stumble all the way.
